sentence.Network_en: She travels con-stantly, moving among her several residences around the world.
sentence.Network_cn: 她经常旅行，穿梭于她在世界各地的多处住所。

sentence.Network_en: Mindful of the needs of its students, Cardiff has invested heavily in providing new and improved residences.
sentence.Network_cn: 考虑到学生的需要，加的夫大学投入了巨资兴建和改善学生宿舍。

sentence.Network_en: They deprived a large number of the overseas Chinese of their means of livelihood and drove them out of their residences in dire poverty.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们剥夺了大批华侨劳动人民的生活资料,然后将他们扫地出门.

entry.def: A residence is a house where people live.

example.ex: She travels constantly, moving among her several residences around the world.
example.tran: 她经常旅行，穿梭于她在世界各地的多处住所。

entry.def: Your place of residence is the place where you live.

example.ex: ...differences among women based on age, place of residence and educational levels.
example.tran: 不同年龄、居住地和教育程度的女性之间的差异

entry.def: Someone's residence in a particular place is the fact that they live there or that they are officially allowed to live there.

example.ex: They had entered the country and had applied for permanent residence...
example.tran: 他们已经入境该国，并申请了永久居留权。

example.ex: She moved out of 28 Barbary Lane to take up residence in a house in Pacific Heights.
example.tran: 她从巴巴里街28号搬出来，住进了太平洋高地住宅区的一所房子。

entry.def: If someone is in residence in a particular place, they are living there.

example.ex: Windsor is open to visitors when the Royal Family is not in residence.
example.tran: 王室未在温莎城堡居住期间，城堡会对游客开放。

entry.def: An artist or writer in residence is one who teaches in an institution such as a university or theatre company.

example.ex: Wakoski is writer in residence at Michigan State University.
example.tran: 瓦科斯基是密歇根州立大学的常驻作家。

example.ex: ...former Chicago Symphony composer in residence, John Corliano.
example.tran: 约翰·科利亚诺，芝加哥交响乐团的前任常驻作曲家

Sentence.sentence: Researchers also observed problems resulting from pairing interracial students in residences.
